<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===- LoopFlatten.cpp - Loop flattening pass------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass flattens pairs nested loops into a single loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The intention is to optimise loop nests like this, which together access an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// array linearly:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   for (int i = 0; i &lt; N; ++i)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     for (int j = 0; j &lt; M; ++j)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//       f(A&#91;i&#42;M+j&#93;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// into one loop:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   for (int i = 0; i &lt; (N&#42;M); ++i)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     f(A&#91;i&#93;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It can also flatten loops where the induction variables are not used in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// loop. This is only worth doing if the induction variables are only used in an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// expression like i&#42;M+j. If they had any other uses, we would have to insert a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// div/mod to reconstruct the original values, so this wouldn&#39;t be profitable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We also need to prove that N&#42;M will not overflow. The preferred solution is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to widen the IV, which avoids overflow checks, so that is tried first. If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the IV cannot be widened, then we try to determine that this new tripcount</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// expression won&#39;t overflow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Q: Does LoopFlatten use SCEV?</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Short answer: Yes and no.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Long answer:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For this transformation to be valid, we require all uses of the induction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// variables to be linear expressions of the form i&#42;M+j. The different Loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// APIs are used to get some loop components like the induction variable,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compare statement, etc. In addition, we do some pattern matching to find the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// linear expressions and other loop components like the loop increment. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// latter are examples of expressions that do use the induction variable, but</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// are safe to ignore when we check all uses to be of the form i&#42;M+j. We keep</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// track of all of this in bookkeeping struct FlattenInfo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We assume the loops to be canonical, i.e. starting at 0 and increment with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1 This makes RHS of the compare the loop tripcount (with the right</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// predicate). We use SCEV to then sanity check that this tripcount matches</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with the tripcount as computed by SCEV.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We require all uses of both induction variables to match this pattern:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopflatten-cpp-/flatteninfo/#aa100845a2f9c04887ba87d67177ea037"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopflatten-cpp-/flatteninfo/#aa100845a2f9c04887ba87d67177ea037">OuterInductionPHI</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// induction variables, which are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// expected to start at zero and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                        </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// increment by one on each loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopflatten-cpp-/flatteninfo/#a83dae789be778571af61ea90f2e64c8c"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopflatten-cpp-/flatteninfo/#a83dae789be778571af61ea90f2e64c8c">InnerTripCount</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The product of these two tripcounts</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                   </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// tripcount. Also used to recognise a</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the use is in the compare (which is also the condition of the inner</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// branch) then the compare has been altered by another transformation e.g</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// icmp ult %inc, tripcount -&gt; icmp ult %j, tripcount-1, where tripcount is</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="432"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Find Compare and make sure it is valid. getLatchCmpInst checks that the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><span class="doxyHighlight">  IterationInstructions.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl/#a9d834ae3da8c62c2b668dada51335eb0">insert</a>(BackBranch);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><span class="doxyHighlight">  IterationInstructions.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl/#a9d834ae3da8c62c2b668dada51335eb0">insert</a>(Compare);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="444"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Found comparison: &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">; Compare-&gt;dump());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="445"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="446"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Find increment and trip count.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="447"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There are exactly 2 incoming values to the induction phi; one from the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="448"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pre-header and one from the latch. The incoming latch value is the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="449"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// increment variable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="450"><span class="doxyHighlight">  Increment =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="451"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;BinaryOperator&gt;</a>(InductionPHI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode/#ab2db7609ec72b1af2f91d47e40dc3722">getIncomingValueForBlock</a>(Latch));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="452"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((Compare-&gt;getOperand(0) != Increment || !Increment-&gt;hasNUses(2)) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="453"><span class="doxyHighlight">      !Increment-&gt;hasNUses(1)) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="454"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Could not find valid increment\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="455"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="456"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="457"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The trip count is the RHS of the compare. If this doesn&#39;t match the trip</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="458"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// count computed by SCEV then this is because the trip count variable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="459"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// has been widened so the types don&#39;t match, or because it is a constant and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="460"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// another transformation has changed the compare (e.g. icmp ult %inc,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="461"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// tripcount -&gt; icmp ult %j, tripcount-1), or both.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="462"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a> = Compare-&gt;getOperand(1);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="463"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="464"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a11a65ce1550eac260dca320a7028328e">verifyTripCount</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>, L, IterationInstructions, InductionPHI, TripCount,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="465"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         Increment, BackBranch, SE, IsWidened);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="466"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468" lineLink="#aadc8ada3f35f60d30e774a6daf23d02f"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#aadc8ada3f35f60d30e774a6daf23d02f">checkPHIs</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-loopflatten-cpp-/flatteninfo/#aedc7147c1826fa149adf71b1d50991b5">FlattenInfo</a> &amp;FI, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targettransforminfo">TargetTransformInfo</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All PHIs in the inner and outer headers must either be:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - The induction PHI, which we are going to rewrite as one induction in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   the new loop. This is already checked by findLoopComponents.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - An outer header PHI with all incoming values from outside the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   LoopSimplify guarantees we have a pre-header, so we don&#39;t need to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   worry about that here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - Pairs of PHIs in the inner and outer headers, which implement a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   loop-carried dependency that will still be valid in the new loop. To</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   be valid, this variable must be modified only in the inner loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The set of PHI nodes in the outer loop header that we know will still be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// valid after the transformation. These will not need to be modified (with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the exception of the induction variable), but we do need to check that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// there are no unsafe PHI nodes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet&lt;PHINode &#42;, 4&gt;</a> SafeOuterPHIs;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The induction PHIs break these rules, and that&#39;s OK because we treat</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check for instructions in the outer but not inner loop. If any of these</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="557"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// have side-effects then this transformation is not legal, and if there is</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><span class="doxyHighlight">      &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00574" /><CodeLine lineNumber="574"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The execution count of the outer loop&#39;s iteration instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (increment, compare and branch) will be increased, but the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// they make a net difference of zero.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (IterationInstructions.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl/#a1f475b0df44ebd7169e720fa1bf9169e">count</a>(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlight">        </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">continue</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The unconditional branch to the inner loop&#39;s header will turn into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a fall-through, so adds no cost.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CanFlatten = <a href="#a0fa90c2a513cc9801d885d999ddac777">CanWidenIV</a>(FI, DT, LI, SE, AC, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It can happen that after widening of the IV, flattening may not be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// possible/happening, e.g. when it is deemed unprofitable. So bail here if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that is the case.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// TODO: IV widening without performing the actual flattening transformation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// is not ideal. While this codegen change should not matter much, it is an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="926"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unnecessary change which is better to avoid. It&#39;s unlikely this happens</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="927"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// often, because if it&#39;s unprofitibale after widening, it should be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="928"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// unprofitabe before widening as checked in the first round of checks. But</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#39;RepeatedInstructionThreshold&#39; is set to only 2, which can probably be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// relaxed. Because this is making a code change (the IV widening, but not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the flattening), we return true here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (FI.Widened &amp;&amp; !CanFlatten)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If we have widened and can perform the transformation, do that here.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (CanFlatten)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#a5e53eb62d81882a5586764e2a9378a49">DoFlattenLoopPair</a>(FI, DT, LI, SE, AC, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa0d69e81725c10fa5407f0bf34462068">TTI</a>, U, MSSAU);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Otherwise, if we haven&#39;t widened the IV, check if the new iteration</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// variable might overflow. In this case, we need to version the loop, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// select the original version at runtime if the iteration space is too</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// large.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a06c60fef11885eadbda4026c83ae9a13">OverflowResult</a> OR = <a href="#aa89462fcd72ee43d1b3f2df0a61a698e">checkOverflow</a>(FI, DT, AC);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (OR == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a06c60fef11885eadbda4026c83ae9a13a9ac50ff0c308dad407db9f09e418363e">OverflowResult::AlwaysOverflowsHigh</a> ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><span class="doxyHighlight">      OR == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a06c60fef11885eadbda4026c83ae9a13ac8cc76d76703c81c16e939be370683c1">OverflowResult::AlwaysOverflowsLow</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Multiply would always overflow, so not profitable\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (OR == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a06c60fef11885eadbda4026c83ae9a13ad4d9862eafa015a05101d9f662bb153a">OverflowResult::MayOverflow</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.isLegalInteger(</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the trip count type isn&#39;t legal then it won&#39;t be possible to check</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="962"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="963"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Multiply might overflow, versioning loop\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="964"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="965"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Version the loop. The overflow check isn&#39;t a runtime pointer check, so we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="966"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pass an empty list of runtime pointer checks, causing LoopVersioning to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="967"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// emit &#39;false&#39; as the branch condition, and add our own check afterwards.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="968"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;CheckBlock = FI.OuterLoop-&gt;getLoopPreheader();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="969"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;RuntimePointerCheck&gt;</a> Checks(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="970"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopversioning">LoopVersioning</a> LVer(LAI, Checks, FI.OuterLoop, LI, DT, SE);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="971"><span class="doxyHighlight">    LVer.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopversioning/#a65b5f9f4aa48ceb121d65679d8b1a689">versionLoop</a>();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="973"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check for overflow by calculating the new tripcount using</span></CodeLine>
